column5: Everytime we have gone to gouin reservoir we have brought potatoes with no problems. they were bought in the USA. We also bring fresh baked bread, meat loaf, lasagna and more. have never had any problems.
Going fishing near ear falls in a month, was wondering if someone knows what the restrictions on fresh produce and meats if any????
Go to the Canadian Food Inspection Agency at inspection.gc.ca, click on Contact Us and send them your question and they will e-mail the answer back.
No Front Bacon please . . . it's just UnCanadian
Potatoes are the only thing prohibitied I am aware of. Researched it in May so unless it has changed that sould be it.
When we take potatoes we boil them first as it is ok to take them this way unless something changed. Fresh ones we buy in Canada.
Why take food across the border? When I went bear hunting a couple springs ago, there were Safeway stores in the mid-sized towns. The other end of the shopping centers usually held Walmart stores.
why not take food across the border. You get the brand names you like and pay less in the USA
USA food is much less money, potatoes are twice as high. I will say they are very good.

My main reason for shopping in the USA other than cost is time. We take a group of 12 on the annual trip so by the time you spend 2 - 3 hours shopping and packing for the last 100 miles of the trip you lose at least a half day and you have part of the crew standing around waiting.
Potatoes bought in Canada should taste good. Odds are very good they were grown in the U.S. of A.
